question: The Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE) prototype detectors are under construction at one of the research centres of:
explanation: DUNE prototype detectors are under construction at the European research center CERN. The Deep Underground Neutrino Experiment (DUNE) is a leading-edge, international experiment for neutrino science and proton decay studies. DUNE will consist of two neutrino detectors placed in the worldâ€™s most intense neutrino beam. One detector will record particle interactions near the source of the beam, at the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory in Batavia, Illinois. A second, much larger, detector will be installed more than a kilometre underground at the Sanford Underground Research Laboratory in Lead, South Dakota- 1,300 kilometers downstream of the source.
